title: Pride Of Britain: Emily Atack, Holly Willoughby and Molly-Mae Hague lead glam
text:
The stars leaded the way on the red carpet (Picture: Getty Images/Rex/PA)

Emily Atack showed off her newly-dyed brunette hair as she and Love Island couple Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury lead the way at the Pride Of Britain Awards 2019 in London alongside the likes of Holly Willoughby, Cheryl , Adam Lambert and Amanda Holden.

Emily stole the show as she sported her new hairstyle, wearing an elegant strapless black gown – which certainly helped to compliment her brunette locks.

Meanwhile, Molly-Mae and Tommy looked pretty loved up as the two appeared together hand in hand on the red carpet.

And while Molly-Mae looked pretty in pink in a stunning dress, Tommy looked very handsome in his dapper suit and tie combo.

Red seemed to be a popular choice of colour for the other stars who appeared at the ceremony – with Holly, Strictly Come Dancing judge Motsi Mabuse and Made In Chelsea star Binky Felstead all rocking up to the event sporting red dresses – which is appropriate enough for the red carpet itself.

Cheryl was also on hand to show her support at the ceremony, as she posed backstage with one of the young award winners while wearing a striking little black dress, while Adam Lambert wore a tweed suit, as he flashed a smile for the camera alongside sergeant Stevie Bull and professional boxer Nicola Adams.

Emily wore a strapless black gown (Picture: Backgrid)

Molly-Mae and Tommy looked very loved up (Picture: Backgrid)

Holly Willoughby was one of many who wore red for the night (Picture: Rex)

Amanda took her crutches (Picture: PA)

Cheryl posed with one of the young award winners, Aaron Hunter (Picture: PA)

Adam Lambert was seen with sergeant Stevie Bull and Nicola Adams (Picture: PA)

Britain’s Got Talent winner Colin Thackery also joined in on the red parade, wearing his signature army gear, while Amanda Holden walked the carpet in crutches after breaking her leg.

But black was also just as popular – Alexandra Burke, Sam Faiers and Michelle Visage were just some of the stars who were all clearly following in the footsteps of Emily – with Alexandra in particular opting for a lacy number.

Newly-single India Reynolds was there (Picture: WireImage)

Good Morning Britain’s Susanna Reid rocked up in pink (Picture: GC Images)

Host Carol Vorderman wore a dramatic gown (Picture: GC Images)

Love Island’s Amber Lewis and Laura Anderson (Picture: GC Images)

Motsi’s Strictly co-star Shirley Ballas also wore a notably striking purple number, while Davina McCall donned a floral print ensemble.

Amanda Holden was on crutches after breaking her leg in two places while on holiday in Europe, but that did not stop her from having the time of her life at the event, as she appeared alongside her Heart Breakfast co-host Jamie Theakston.

Advertisement

There is no Holden her back after all.

Unfortunately, Strictly pro Katya Jones had a spot of back luck with her black dress – as she was seen getting it stepped on by a passer-by.

Strictly Come Dancings Motsi Mabuse wore a stunning floorlength number (Picture: Rex)

Made In Chelsea star Binky Felstead also rocked up in red (Picture: PA)

Britain’s Got Talent winner Colin Thackery wore his signature army gear (Picture: Getty Images)

The Pride Of Britain Awards has taken place every year since 1999, and honours the achievements of British people who have acted extraordinarily in difficult situations.

Speaking about the awards, host Carol Vorderman said: ‘Pride Of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it’s hard to believe it’s 20 years since we first started.

Alexandra Burke wore a lacy black outfit (Picture: Rex)

Sam Faiers also wore black on the red carpet (Picture: Rex)

Michelle Visage dazzled in a glitzy number (Picture: Rex)

Strictly Come Dancing judge Shirley Ballas wore a striking purple gown (Picture: Rex)

Davina McCall opted for a floral ensemble (Picture: Backgrid)

Katya Jones didn’t have much luck with her dress (Picture: Backgrid)

‘In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us.

Advertisement

‘I never failed to be humbled by them, and this year’s are no different.’

The Pride Of Britain Awards will be broadcast on ITV at 8pm on 5 November.
